description: Borrowed from French endothermique, from endo- (“inside”) +‎ thermique (“of heat”), both ultimately from Ancient Greek.

adjectives.description: endothermic (comparative more endothermic, superlative most endothermic)

entries.meaning: (chemistry) Of a chemical reaction that absorbs heat energy from its surroundings.
(zoology) Of an animal whose body temperature is regulated by internal factors.
